Expectation1: Look out for each other's safety and well-being
Situation1: The siblings are walking home from school together on a familiar street.
Expectation2: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation2: You notice a small, contained liquid spill in a walkway that needs to be O39eaned up immediately to prevent slips.
Story: I walked beside my little brother, our backpacks bouncing as we made our way down the street we’d traveled a hundred times before. I kept an eye on him, like Mom always asked, making sure he didn’t dart into the road or get too close to the curb. My phone buzzed in my pocket—a message from my foreman. There was a spill at the site, right in the main walkway, and I was the closest one. He needed me to get there and clean it up before someone slipped. My mind raced. If I left my brother to hurry to the site, he’d have to walk the last few blocks alone, and I’d be breaking the promise I made to always look out for him. But if I stayed with him, the spill could cause an accident at work, and I’d be letting my crew down. I felt the weight of both responsibilities pressing in, my steps slowing as I tried to figure out what to do.
